conclusion: To determine the coefficient of kinetic friction between A and B and the mass of A.
Force F is applied to object A, frictional force exists between A and B, acceleration a of A, and mass m of A.
Frictional force: f = μN, where N = mg.
The graph shows the relationship between acceleration a and force F.
The slope of the line in the graph represents the ratio F/a, equal to the mass of object A.
From the graph: At F = 48 N, the acceleration a = 8 m/s².
The slope F/a = 48/8 = 6 kg, thus the mass of object A is 6 kg.
From the graph, the force needed to initiate motion where a = 0 corresponds to the frictional force f, when F = 24 N.
Using f = μN and N = mg: 24 = μ × 60, solving for μ gives μ = 24/60 = 0.4.
The coefficient of kinetic friction between A and B is 0.4, and the mass of A is 6 kg.
